events.name: Time for the first Singapore Nix/NixOS meetup!
events.description: Our very first Singapore Nix/NixOS meetup on none other than Star Wars Day! Nix and its related technologies bring a radically different approach to server/container management and allows you to provision OS and software in repeatable and consistent ways. The inaugural session will be focused on bringing up a NixOS environment and a workshop covering the various parts of the ecosystem but we will also be covering actual use cases and how to deal with common pain-points in a Nix context. Beginners and experts are equally welcome. In order to assess the level/experience, please take less than 2 minutes to fill this in: https://goo.gl/forms/Ue0Oc4v7j047AS212 Spacemob has graciously offered to provide the venue at their new facility right next to Kent Ridge MRT. Should any companies be interested in sponsoring pizzas, please let me know.
events.location: Spacemob Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive #02-05, Singapore 118222

events.name: May 2017 Meetup @ Google Singapore
events.description: Stepan Goncharov JOIN US IN OUR GITTER CHATROOM: </a>https://gitter.im/AndroidInAsia/ May meetup at Google Singapore Attendee information submission required for security at entry for the event: <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/uUZp9LsasB24z6bb2">https://goo.gl/forms/uUZp9LsasB24z6bb2 Agenda for the Night Session 1 - Android Things - IoT with Android by Denis Nek Session 2 - "Introduction to rxJava2" by Stepan Goncharov Rx(reactive extensions) is a powerful tool for making async code easier to write, maintain and less bug-prone, but it might not always be clear what exactly RxJava is doing and why doing things that way helps make the code better. In this talk, we’ll discuss how things were traditionally done in Android, problematic areas with these approaches, and how RxJava can help solve some of these issues. No prior Rx knowledge is assumed. Sponsors Food and Refreshments sponsored by 100offer. About 100offer. For top software engineers, opportunities are never lacking. Yet, those that are a good fit are extremely rare. At 100offer, our product, service, and content are tailored to help you discover and land the best career opportunities possible - and nothing less. Check it out at <a href="https://www.100offer.com/"></a>https://www.100offer.com/.
events.location: Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-01

events.name: May Meetup
events.description:
Hi friends! We're thrilled to have our first Serverless Singapore meetup in May.  



Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event 


Scheduled Talks  • 'Azure Functions' by Kenneth Ham • 'Unikernels & Serverless Platforms' by Madhuri Yechuri   


Information for Attendees Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security! The meetup will be held at Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Conference room SINOMB 22CF-12. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is EW14 / NS26 Raffles Place. 


Sponsors
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Being Agile: Incremental Refactoring
events.description:
Speaker: Guillaume Duquesnay, Agile Coach & Facilitator
See below what Guillaume is going to share:
Incremental refactoring is recommended whenever you have to touch your architecture in order to (tick the boxes that applies) [ ] clean a pool of mud in your system (that thing we call technical debt) [ ] incorporate new feature twisting your existing system [ ] freshen up your technical architecture
There's a lot of recommendations supporting an incremental approach, but when it comes to a practical approach like “how the hell are we suppose to start tomorrow?", what you find is usually too general or too conceptual.
Or so we found, several years ago, when my team and I were facing a deep refactoring. We needed to transform the architecture to bring this new feature to life, but the tunnel effect was putting at risk the whole delivery timeline. The target was a public media event, no chance to change the date. The Product Owner, an amazing person, trusted us, but he was freaking out. And we did too, actually. Eager to find a more progressive transformation of our architecture, we were unable to find a step by step approach that didn’t involve books and weeks of learning. We came to create our own workshop to design it. It was very casually thought, but it worked magic. A breakthrough. It made me completely change the way I'm coaching agile team when facing any architecture problem.
In this meetup I'd like not only to share this workshop but to help you experiment it on your real life cases. Coz we're coders, right? We don't talk. We practice. We test. So join us, bring your refactoring problems, and lets put them to the grill.
events.location: Paypal Singapore, 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: DIY Light Saber workshop
events.description:
https://diylightsaber.eventbrite.sg

May the 4th be with you! 
Make your own DIY lightsaber using everyday materials and at the same time explore the different types of LEDs, drawing circuits & soldering. Sign up through the eventbrite tickets!
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
